title.narrative: 1.1 S & D:NUTRITION CARE AND SERVICES

description.narrative: 1.1 S & D - By 2017 nutrition and care services are accessed by at least 90% of families with children or pregnant and lactating mothers in underserved areas to reduce under-nutrition through multi-sectoral efforts., which contributes to Child Health, Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017 improved quality social services are available and utilized, so disparities and inequalities are reduced in Health, HIV AIDS, Nutrition, Water Sanitation, Education & Child protection
